column4: Im very disapointed at 8.04 release, it been hell for me all the way (ok well not hell, but close to it)
i think its awesome, no probs here... one on pc i just built, 1 on an old pc, and 1 on a fairly new laptop

It was very anoying to get it running in dual head on my desktop (nvidia) new xorg screen res configurator is useless.  Language switch shortcut was remove/replaced . Now try to upgrade my Dell Desktop to get a blackscren at reboot, tryed to boot the install Cd and same result.  New VNC clients suck, can't access ubuntu 7.10 default vnc server, had to install console vnc clients...
what nvidia card do you have? my dual screens work fine
I finally got it to work, Nvidi 8600 GT.  Had to install nvidia drivers (from the repo)(first time I try to load it, it say it was already installed but not running)
well, all you would have to do was enable in hardware driver manager, then install nvidia-settings, and thats it.
normally yes, problem is on my first install, it show the drivers as already installed..
it was installed, Enable but `Not in Use`
It probably a bug that when the install has NOT sync with the repository atless one, it show bad informations
well, saying that it installed and enable when it not installed... I call that a BUG
well, you would be misidentifying it.
Im a linux fan, but I know when to admit when it suck... and 8.04 ain't great in my experience so far
well, you can't blame the OS for user incompetence.. thats all i'll say on it.
hey kid, read back what I said before... OS tell USER it installed and enable. USER stupid to think the OS is right ?
hey kid, read back what i said
if you don't like my answers, you're the one who's continued this conversation
